section.name: How Can I Help
section.p:
Every volunteer project gets its strength from its participants. We invite everybody to participate in Cayenne in any way that is suitable for you.
If you are willing to help, you can do it in many different ways:
By contributing code for one or more tasks listsed below
By contributing documentation
By testing Cayenne and reporting bugs
By using Cayenne and reporting bugs
By suggesting your own ideas on the mailing list
If you want to become a contributor, first you should probably subscribe to Cayenne Developer Mailing List. to see what issues are discussed and to communicate with the project team.

Normally code and documentation contributions are made via patches sent to developer list. A good discussion on how to create and submit code patches is located at Jakarta Apache site. You can use all these hints as related to Cayenne.

subsection.name: Top Priority
subsection.p: Cayenne Modeler GUI. Currently in progress.
Test with Oracle. Make sure test cases pass
Test with PostgreSQL. Make sure test cases pass.

subsection.name: Medium Priority
subsection.p: Allow SelectQuery to hold arbitrary attributes beyond ObjEntity attributes set. Right now only SqlSelectQuery has this feature, must add it to SelectQuery as well.

p.strong: Mapping of query qualifier parameters to DbAttributes (or maybe database types).
SQL schemas support in test cases.

subsection.name: Lower Priority
subsection.p: Test with other database engines Current implementation should support Oracle, Sybase, MySQL and PostgreSQL. We need to write database adapters for other engines as well

Application server integration. Cayenne has basic JNDI support. We are running with Jakarta-Tomcat container. Research on how to use Cayenne with other containers like WebLogic, WebSphere, etc. still needs to be done.
"To Many" relationship Ordering. Users should be able to specify "to many" relationship ordering in the map. In current release objects will be returned in a database "natural" order.
Flattened relationships. Though current API "supports" mapping of ObjRelationship across multiple DbRelationships, it doesn't really work. Real support still needs to be built in Cayenne.
Selecting attributes for optimistic locking. DataMap should support arbitrary attributes in "optimistic" locking. Now only primary key attributes are used.
